w:r.w:t: Managing and Use of SQL Tuning Sets
The advisors in 10g use SQL tuning sets instead of SQL workloads.
A SQL tuning set (STS) is a database object that includes one or more SQL statements
along with their execution statistics and execution context, and could include a user
priority ranking. You can load SQL statements into a SQL tuning set from different
You can filter SQL statements using the application module name and action, or any of
the execution statistics. In addition, you can rank statements based on any
You can use an STS as input to SQL Tuning Advisor, which performs automatic tuning
of the SQL statements based on other user-specified input parameters.
You can export SQL tuning sets from one database to another, enabling transfer of SQL workloads
between databases for remote performance diagnostics and tuning
How to create a SQL tuning set manually (without OEM) :

Create the SQL Tuning Advisor task that the SQL tuning set will be associated with

After creating the sql tuning set, we need to load it with some content.
You can load from baselines, the AWR, another SQL tuning set or the cursor cache.

Populating the STS from AWR snapshots
open ref_cur for select VALUE(p) from table( DBMS_SQLTUNE.SELECT_WORKLOAD_REPOSITORY( &begin_snap_id, &end_snap_id ,
Populating the STS from the AWR snapshots based on particular SQL text
Populating the STS directly from the Cursor Cache
The CAPTURE_CURSOR_CACHE_SQLSET function enables the capture of the full system workload by repeatedly polling the shared SQL area over a specified interval.
This function more efficient than repeatedly using the SELECT_CURSOR_CACHE and LOAD_SQLSET procedures to capture the shared SQL area over an extended period.
Populating the STS from the Cursor Cache based on criteria

Viewing the SQL Statements Inside the STS
Note how this uses a table function SELECT_SQLSET. Others are DBA_SQLSET, DBA_SQLSET_STATEMENT
SELECT sql_plan FROM TABLE(DBMS_SQLTUNE.SELECT_SQLSET( 'TEST_STS', null, null, null,null, null, 1, null, 'ALL' ) );
You can update and delete SQL statements from an STS based on a search condition.
In the following example, the DELETE_SQLSET procedure deletes SQL statements from
my_sql_tuning_set that have been executed less than fifty times.
SQL Tuning Set Views in Data Dictionary
SQL tuning set views, such as DBA_SQLSET, DBA_SQLSET_BINDS, DBA_SQLSET_
Information on captured execution plans for statements in SQL tuning sets are
displayed in the DBA_SQLSET_PLANS and USER_SQLSET_PLANS views
